title: Everyday Ceramic Design Project: Multimedia Interaction and Mathematical Modeling

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational geometry, understanding of 3D space, and experience with simple digital tools
context.additional_context: In smartphone-based limited-technology environments, students explore mathematical principles of ceramic design via multimedia interaction. They solve real design problems while simultaneously advancing mathematical modeling and creative problem-solving skills.

learning_goals: Students can analyze functional requirements of ceramic products and convert them into 3D sketches.
Learners can evaluate the structural stability of ceramic forms by applying mathematical concepts such as proportion, symmetry, and spatial coordinates.
Students will create ≥3-stage design prototypes using multimedia interaction tools (Scratch, GeoGebra) and propose ≥2 specific improvements based on peer reviews and teacher feedback.

Learners will identify three types of mathematical problems (e.g., area calculation, ratio adjustment) arising during the design process, perform ≥2 iterative experiments and data analyses per problem, and derive solutions with ≤10% error rates.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
